result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Earl Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Attempt Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 3: Provide DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3:
- No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or alcohol.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 2, and 3 as AMENDED:  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

As to Count 1 as amended:  
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, straight time.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

As to Count 2 as amended: 
Court ordered defendant to serve 4.5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1, straight time.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

As to Count 3 as amended:  
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2, straight time.  COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, with huber for work, treatment, and medical.  SENTENCE STAYED UNTIL 10-26-2015 at 5:00 pm.
- No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with any weapons. 
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens.  No positive results.
- No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or alcohol.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.  Any bail on deposit to apply. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs during termof probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.  

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Lawrence Earl Parks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant termporarily entered a plea of not guilty. 

Defendant is charged as follows:
Count 1:   ENTRY INTO LOCKED BUILDING, DWELLING OR ROOM, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.15(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 2:   ATTEMPT THEFT (VALUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,500), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.32, a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 3:   DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
